about.summary:
HyperSpyUI tries to bring a streamlined user interface to the powerful multi-dimensional analysis capabilities of HyperSpy. HyperSpy is an open source Python library which provides tools to facilitate data analysis of multidimensional datasets.
HyperSpy aims at making it easy and natural to apply analytical procedures that operate on an individual signal to multidimensional arrays, as well as providing easy access to analytical tools that exploit the multidimensionality of the dataset.
While the UI tries to create a simple and intuitive interface to HyperSpy, it still retains the raw power of HyperSpy via the UI’s built in IPython console, which runs on the same Python kernel as the UI.

HyperSpyUI tries to bring a streamlined user interface to the powerful multi-dimensional analysis capabilities of HyperSpy. HyperSpy is an open source Python library which provides tools to facilitate data analysis of multidimensional datasets.
HyperSpy aims at making it easy and natural to apply analytical procedures that operate on an individual signal to multidimensional arrays, as well as providing easy access to analytical tools that exploit the multidimensionality of the dataset.
While the UI tries to create a simple and intuitive interface to HyperSpy, it still retains the raw power of HyperSpy via the UI’s built in IPython console, which runs on the same Python kernel as the UI.

name: hyperspyui
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "hyperspyUI" %}
{% set version = "2.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d2a4d79a21a0ee2ee07aa58b8e31cfd3ad38c330ab994f576ac931510a4886da

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  entry_points:
    - hyperspyui = hyperspyui.__main__:main

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.7
    - pip
  run:
    - __{{ target_os }}
    - python >=3.7
    - exspy
    - hyperspy-base >=2.0
    - hyperspy-gui-traitsui >=2.0
    - pyqode.core >=4.0.10
    - pyqode.python >=4.0.2
    - pyflakes
    - autopep8
    - qtconsole >=5.2.0
    - qtpy
    - ffmpeg
    - ipykernel >=5.2.0
    - traitsui >=5.2.0
  run_constrained:
    - menuinst >=1.4.17   # [win]

test:
  imports:
    - hyperspyui
    - hyperspyui.__main__

  # commands:
  #  - DISPLAY=localhost:1.0 xvfb-run -a bash -c 'hyperspyui -h'
  #  - DISPLAY=localhost:1.0 xvfb-run -a bash -c 'pytest --pyargs hyperspyui'

  # requires:
  #  - pytest
  #  - pytest-qt

app:
  entry: hyperspyui
  summary: HyperSpyUI
  type: desk

about:
  home: https://github.com/hyperspy/hyperspyUI
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later

  summary: "HyperSpyUI tries to bring a streamlined user interface to the powerful multi-dimensional analysis capabilities of HyperSpy. HyperSpy is an open source Python library which provides tools to facilitate data analysis of multidimensional datasets.\nHyperSpy aims at making it easy and natural to apply analytical
    procedures that operate on an individual signal to multidimensional arrays, as well as providing easy access to analytical tools that exploit the multidimensionality of the dataset.\nWhile the UI tries to create a simple and intuitive interface to HyperSpy, it still retains the raw power of HyperSpy via the UI’s built
    in IPython console, which runs on the same Python kernel as the UI. "
  license_file: COPYING.txt
  doc_url: http://hyperspy.org/hyperspyUI/
  dev_url: https://github.com/hyperspy/hyperspyUI

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - vidartf
    - francisco-dlp
    - ericpre
